robot

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.Navigator

  • public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Navigator class provides all the methods to allow the robot to move and navigate through the map.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Solvie Lee

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigator(Odometer odo, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor sensorMotor)
      Default constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Odometer getOdo()
      Allows outside classes to access the navigator's odometer
      double normalize(double deg)
      Helper method for the turnTo method that normalizes the angle.
      boolean[] scan()
      Method to allow navigator to scan left and right for an empty path.
      void setDetectionInfo(boolean[] info, boolean[] update)
      Allows outside classes to set the boolean values of whether there is an object in front of the robot, whether the object is within D cm and whether the object's color was seen.
      void setObjectDist(double dist)
      Method to allow the ObjectDetector to tell the Navigator how far an obstacle is.
      void setSpeeds(float lSpd, float rSpd)
      Method to set motors going at the specified speed and direction
      void stopMotors()
      Stops the motors
      void travelBackwards(double distance)
      Method to allow the robot to travel backwards a set distance
      void travelForwards(double distance)
      Method to allow the robot to travel forwards a set distance
      void travelTo(double x, double y)
      The conventional method of travelling to a point; calculates and turns to the heading it must face and drives the distance that it must go to arrive at the destination described by input points.
      boolean[] travelToWithAvoidance(double x, double y)
      Travels to the destination point in a similar manner as the travelTo method.
      void travelUntilNoObstacle(boolean left)
      Travels to the destination point in a similar manner as the travelTo method, However it will slow down when it sees an obstacle, and stop when it is a certain distance away from it.
      void turnTo(double theta, boolean stop)
      This method turns the robot in place to face the specified destination heading, in the optimal direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigator

        public Navigator(Odometer odo,
                 EV3LargeRegulatedMotor sensorMotor)
        Default constructor
        Parameters:
        odo - the Odometer whose values are to be used for dead-reckoning.
        sensorMotor - the motor that controls the movement of the front sensors (light and ultrasonic)

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        The conventional method of travelling to a point; calculates and turns to the heading it must face and drives the distance that it must go to arrive at the destination described by input points. May be deprecated.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of destination
        y - Y coordinate of destination

      • travelToWithAvoidance

        public boolean[] travelToWithAvoidance(double x,
                                       double y)
        Travels to the destination point in a similar manner as the travelTo method. However, it will slow down when it sees an obstacle, and stop when it is a certain distance away from it. (TODO: define that distance, maybe pass it in as a parameter)
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of destination
        y - Y coordinate of destination
        Returns:
        A boolean value that is false if the robot detected an obstacle and true if it was able to reach the destination point without detecting any obstacles.

      • travelUntilNoObstacle

        public void travelUntilNoObstacle(boolean left)
        Travels to the destination point in a similar manner as the travelTo method, However it will slow down when it sees an obstacle, and stop when it is a certain distance away from it.
        Parameters:
        left - whether the robot turned left to avoid the obstacle

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta,
                   boolean stop)
        This method turns the robot in place to face the specified destination heading, in the optimal direction.
        Parameters:
        theta - heading to turn to
        stop - whether motors should stop

      • normalize

        public double normalize(double deg)
        Helper method for the turnTo method that normalizes the angle.
        Parameters:
        deg - the angle to normalize
        Returns:
        normalized angle

      • scan

        public boolean[] scan()
        Method to allow navigator to scan left and right for an empty path.
        Returns:
        boolean array of whether there was an empty path found (first value) and whether the direction found was left (second value)

      • travelBackwards

        public void travelBackwards(double distance)
        Method to allow the robot to travel backwards a set distance
        Parameters:
        distance - to travel

      • travelForwards

        public void travelForwards(double distance)
        Method to allow the robot to travel forwards a set distance
        Parameters:
        distance - to travel

      • setSpeeds

        public void setSpeeds(float lSpd,
                      float rSpd)
        Method to set motors going at the specified speed and direction
        Parameters:
        lSpd - left motor speed. Positive if forwards, negative if backwards.
        rSpd - right motor speed. Positive if forwards, negative if backwards.

      • stopMotors

        public void stopMotors()
        Stops the motors

      • setDetectionInfo

        public void setDetectionInfo(boolean[] info,
                             boolean[] update)
        Allows outside classes to set the boolean values of whether there is an object in front of the robot, whether the object is within D cm and whether the object's color was seen.
        Parameters:
        info - the boolean values
        update - boolean values of whether we want to update this value.

      • setObjectDist

        public void setObjectDist(double dist)
        Method to allow the ObjectDetector to tell the Navigator how far an obstacle is.
        Parameters:
        dist - how far an obstacle is

      • getOdo

        public Odometer getOdo()
        Allows outside classes to access the navigator's odometer
        Returns:
        the navigator's odometer.
